page.title: 05Dedham A Conservation Area
page.content:
Life in a Conservation Area
Much of Dedham is a Conservation Area. This means that the area is protected from development as much as possible. You have to ask the council for permission to cut-down,uproot or lop a tree.You give them six weeks notice of your intentions and if they object then you cannot proceed.If a tree is dead,dying or dangerous then you can cut them down but replace them. Buildings are protected, Grade 3 listed buildings are mostly built between 1700 and 1840. Grade 2 are historical buildings built before 1700 provided they havent changed too much. Grade 1 are the most important buildings of great historical interest. To change them you must ask the Minister of the Environment.
